articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Trump must remember that the only way to bring home Israeli prisoners is to respect the ceasefire between Israel and Hamas, senior Hamas official Sami Abu Zuhri told Reuters.
articles.title: Ceasefire is only way to bring Israeli prisoners home, Hamas official says

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: King Abdullah has said he rejected any moves to annex land and displace Palestinians.
articles.title: Trump and Jordan's king set for tense meeting on Gaza's future

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim
articles.description: North Korean state media on Wednesday denounced U.S. President Donald Trump's proposal to take over Gaza and relocate Palestinians as ludicrous and accused Washington of extortion.
articles.title: North Korea condemns Trump's Gaza takeover proposal as 'ludicrous'

articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: U.S. special envoy Steve Witkoff, on a visit to Russia, secured the release on Tuesday of Marc Fogel, an American schoolteacher detained in Russia since August 2021, the White House said.
articles.title: Trump envoy secures release of American Marc Fogel from Russia

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The head of Russia's powerful Orthodox Church said in remarks published late on Tuesday that "weirdos" were trying to spread paganism in the combat zone in Ukraine and called for efforts to counter attempts to weaken the church's influence there.
articles.title: Russian patriarch says 'weirdos' spreading paganism on Ukraine frontline

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's Defence Ministry launched a recruitment drive for young people on Tuesday, encouraging 18- to 24-year-olds to serve in the military for a year for the equivalent of about $24,000 and hefty bonuses.
articles.title: Ukraine Defence Ministry offers contract stints spurring young to fight

articles.author: Liz Lee, Ben Blanchard
articles.description: Two U.S. Navy ships sailed through the sensitive Taiwan Strait this week in the first such mission since President Donald Trump took office last month, drawing an angry reaction from China, which said the mission increased security risks.
articles.title: First US Navy ships sail through Taiwan Strait since Trump inauguration

articles.author: Jonathan Allen
articles.description: The novelist Salman Rushdie showed a jury his blinded right eye on Tuesday as he testified against the man charged with trying to murder him at a talk at a rural New York venue in 2022.
articles.title: Novelist Rushdie takes stand in trial of his accused stabber

articles.author: Pavel Polityuk, Valentyn Ogirenko, Serhiy Karazy
articles.description: Russia's early morning missile attack on Kyiv killed at least one civilian, injured three, and sparked several fires throughout the city, Ukrainian officials said.
articles.title: Russia's missile attack on Kyiv kills one, sparks fires, Ukraine says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Canada, fulfilling a promise made to U.S. President Donald Trump, on Tuesday appointed a senior intelligence official to the new post of fentanyl czar, saying he would coordinate the fight against smuggling of the drug.
articles.title: Canada appoints new fentanyl czar to coordinate fight against smuggling
